creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: head and torso of a man with a moustache and receding hairline, holding a pen-like tool in his PL hand; many diagonal hatched lines; man wears jacket, tie and vest; loose style
inscription:
Signature, Date, Label

-- in graphite on verso of sheet: 7971 / 1-1 | 7- (circled)

Labels on back of frame:
-- Upper left: The Minneapolis Institute of Arts, no. L66.139 / Lent by Allan Frumkin Gallery
-- Top right: Allan Frumkin Gallery 32 East 57th Street New York 22 / Lovis Corinth / \"Self-Portrait\" / letter verso / ink 1923
-- Center: Gallery of Modern Art / 663.64 Frumkin N.Y. / Corinth / 8 (circled)
-- Center: Drawings and Watercolors from Minnesota Private Collections  / L71.65 / catalogue no. 65. LOVIS CORINTH \"Self Portrait\" 1923 / The Minneapolis Institute of Arts May 13-June 13, 1971
-- Bottom edge: Max Granick frames 52 West 56 St  N.Y.C. 19
markings: four labels on back of frame: (old MIA loan label, L66.139), Allan Frumkin Gallery label, Gallery of Modern Art label, MIA exhibition label [\"Drawings & Watercolors from Minnesota Private Collections,\" L71.65]
medium: Pen and brown ink on cream wove Japanese paper
provenance: [Allan Frumkin Gallery, New York, until 1966; sold to Andrus at Mia-organized loan exhibition and show]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; Elizabeth Andrus, Wayzata, Minn.
signed: signed and dated in brown ink, lower right: [Lovis Corinth / 19 April 1923.]; letter on verso in pen and ink, in artist\'s hand
title: Self-Portrait
